name: Theresa Brooks
text: Kate was fantastic for our first overnight, hiking trip! She was excited and supportive (literally) of getting us to falls which were amazing! I never would have seen what all the area had to offer without her. She was also a great problem solver when my tent decided to leak. If you want to experience the great outdoors with a patient and knowledgeable hike leader, contact Butterfly Outdoors!

resp.text: Thanks Theresa! I really enjoyed leading your group, and I’m glad it was such a positive experience for you as well.

name: Carrie Lin
text: Katie does such an amazing job educating everyone from the novice level (me!) to the more experienced hikers that take her courses. She is so knowledgeable yet makes it not so overwhelming when you are learning from her. Definitely recommended!!

resp.text: Thanks Carrie! I appreciate the review and am so happy you enjoyed our trip. It’s fun having students eager to learn and up for a challenge!

name: Jeremy West
text: Just saying hello

name: Amber O'Donnell
text: It was so much fun to just hang out with friends and chill! It’s a little backwoods floating place that is worth the drive! Turn your phone off and enjoy!

name: Jessica Garcia
text:
1. You dont need ID, dont have to sign waivers; They don't accept plastic so take cash
2. They usually answer the phone
3. They are 1 mile river float outfitters
4. Takes about 3 hours to complete
5. $10 a person; $5 per cooler; same price if you being your own float
6. Canned Beer/alcohol allowed. There were some very drunk guys on the river today and one crew was smoking weed. You end up with lots of people you don't know and kids are exposed to a lot of foul language.
7. No bathrooms or changing rooms
8. 3-4 small but intimidating "rapids."
9. Cliff with diving platforms at end

name: dem sub
text: Not worth paying some lazy owner who does not put anything back to the environment or even keep the parking area clean. This place was run down years ago. I think it might have been nice back in the day but as of June 2020 the land has been destroyed the water is full of trash and it shows the owner only wants your money at 10$ a person and 5$ for your cooler even if you brought your own floats. They make more than enough money to take care of the place but they don't even attempt. Its so sad that a nice place gets ran into the dirt because of irresponsible ownership

name: Jacque Miller
text: What a great time! Beautiful scenery and refreshing Cool water! Must got at least once. You will leave with a couple bruises from the rocks but nothing to awful! Bring a trash bag. Unfortunately, a lot of people do not and cans are all over.

name: Jaime Parmer
text:
So much fun!!! Good times, good friends (old & new) just good ol' country, glad I live where this is easily accessible, & blessed.
#riverlife

name: Greg Pennington
text: We had a blast! Take a cooler float and relax.

name: Kayti Wunderlich
text: I hit my head underwater be careful lol

name: April Danielson
text:
I would recommend doing it at least once. I’m not sure we’ll go back just because there is so much else to do, but the scenery really was beautiful. Saw turtles, rock croppings and beautiful trees. Some parts of the area were really littered with cans and bottles, which is very unfortunate, but there was a lot of alcohol consumed by other parties around us the day we went and I guess the trash is a result of lots of that.

Tube rental is $10 per tube and $5 per cooler tube. They take you to the river in the back of a pickup truck. You float the river and then end right by where you started by just walking up the hill to your car.

One bit of advice that we didn’t know before we went the first time is that it is really good to bring your own raft that you can sit on or in. We saw people with small raft type boats and others with floats that you sit in with a protected bottom to them. (I think they come here quite a bit and have the trip down to a science.) Make sure any float you bring is thick and won’t puncture easily by the rocks — like a ski float or something. You need something that will protect your body from the rocks on the rapids. The rapids would be a whole lot more fun if you didn’t have to worry about rocks getting you from the bottom. We’ve all gotten some skinned knees and bruises from the rocks. (We rented the tubes they had at the place.). If you don’t have a float you can bring, lift your body all the way up in your inner tube as you go down the rapids to try to stay off of the rocks.

The tube rental area is a campy place with no real place to picnic. They do have a small bathroom, but it was about to overflow while we were there, so we didn’t use it. They also have a hose by the bathrooms that you can use to clean the sand out of your shoes which is very helpful.

A few random thoughts ...

The first beach is the best. Eat here if you plan to have lunch. The second beach had lots of glass and bugs on it. The last area doesn’t really have a place to eat on it.

You HAVE TO HAVE WATER SHOES of some kind. Chacos, Tevas, water shoes. Your feet will get cut on rocks and glass on the beaches if you do not.

Another thought... the rapids can be tough on people that are somewhat fragile. I would recommend that people who are fragile or young be in a boat and not on a tube. The rapids can be just too rough on them.

Bring a trash bag for your cans. You’ll need it. Maybe you can help clean up too by picking up a few of the trash items that you see. (Overall, I expected it to be more trashy with some of the comments that I had read on here, but it wasn’t as bad as I thought.)

This may be one of your favorite places to visit and you come back a lot. Or it may be something you do and say you’ve done it and don’t ever come back. Try it at least once.

name: Michael Ledbetter
text: Nothing fancy just a nice place to go float down the little cahaba. Great fishing too. Also just a nice place to go swim during the hot summer months. I dont know where you can find colder water in central alabama.

name: hank armstrong
text: You won't find a better place to enjoy a true Alabama experience. Such a fun place to visit and enjoy the outdoors.

name: Kaitlyn Phillips
text: Anyone know what age the child has to be to go?

name: c POWERS
text: Hell of a good time... everytime!!!

name: Justin Keeton
text: Had a blast.with the family and friends

name: Mike Ellis
text: Most fun you will ever have!!!!

name: Caleb Bowsher
text: Best fun in Alabama!!

name: sam childers
text: always have fun

name: Rebecca
text: So much fun!

name: Gwendolyn Treptow
text: Love it!! One of my favorite things of the summer!!

name: Sam Mcgowen
text: Great tubing place to go to

name: greg pennington
text: Great time!

name: Christin Turner
text: So much fun!!

name: nyswede anderson
text: Water was a little low, so your backside got beat up on the rapids, but it was a blast. Old School fun.

name: Troy Venable
text: Trash all down the river.

name: Edward Greer
text: Fun times!!

name: Mackey Mckinzie
text: Just gas

name: Tiffany Baker
text: Fun, relaxing tubing

name: Joe Jones
text: Last night my family and I took the sunset dolphin cruise. Had a fun time, wish we would have seen more dolphins but we know it is a hit or miss on that. The Crew was very nice and friendly, the put there masks on when the need too, were very skilled at handling the sails of the boat. It made for a very enjoyable cruise.

name: Matthew Henderson
text: My wife and I got to come on a sunset dolphin cruise and we had a really good time. The crew was friendly and the view was nice as the sun was setting.

name: Jeremy Brewer
text:
Such a wonderfully peaceful ride.
They provide snacks and drinks.
A couple on our trip got a bit seasick (nauseated) and the crew was right there with seasick pills and oils to help them overcome it and enjoy their ride. The couple didn't even ask for anything, but the crew member was right there to help!

Saw lots of dolphins playing in the bay right next to us at most times.

It's a super relaxing ride to just hang out and watch the beautiful sunset.
